attributes.action: Give England and Wales a referendum on Scotland's continued membership of the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Everyone would benefit by ridding parliament of Scottish MPs meddling in the affairs of the rest of the union as they do now. 

In 2012/13 total public spending in Scotland was estimated to be £65.2bn, or 9.3% of total UK spending, with a population of 8.3%.
Even by the most generous measure, Scotland raised £53.1bn in taxes during 2012/13 and spent £65.2bn, leaving the country £12.1bn short. In the same period, the UK had a shortfall of £117.4bn.
 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-28879267
attributes.background: Allow Scotland to fund their own lavish social security system, free university tuition fees, free prescriptions & public services in the way that the English & Welsh taxpayers have to now. Scotland could fund their own armed forces, organise their own currency & join the back of the EU entry queue.
